topic.title: Using Objects to Define the Top of the Model

para.text: Using Objects to Define the Top of the Model
) will be displayed. Uncheck the check box next to
to hide all the objects. Then click on the + symbol next to
to display groups of data sets that have objects that are used to set the values of those data sets. Similarly click on the + symbol next to
. Then check the check box next to "Model_Top" to display all the objects that are used to set the values of the "Model_Top" data set (fig.

). On the top view of the model, there are now several objects that determine the elevation of the top of the model. The elevation is determined by interpolation among these objects. To get a better view of the top of the grid in the 3-D view (fig.

. Then on the 3-Dview of the model, click and drag to rotate the view of the model to get a better view of the grid. To see the bottom of the upper aquifer, locate the cube with the red square above and to the left of the top view of the model. Click on the cube below the red square to move the selected layer down by one (fig.
). The 3-D view will be updated to show the bottom of the upper aquifer.
